= Development Widgets: Settings.xml =
Each widget is required to have the file settings.xml inside the root-folder of the widget. Here is an example with comments:
    
{{{
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!-- root -->
<settings>
    <!--  short description of the widget -->
	<about>A template and help for developing widgets with Iframe-style</about>
    <!-- version of widget-->
    <version>1.0</version>
    <!-- link to website -->
    <link>none</link>
    <!-- name of author -->
    <author>Fredrik Johansson</author>
    <!-- icon to widget relative to main widget folder (can be left empty and a generic icon will be loaded) -->
    <icon>help-desk-icon.png</icon>
    <!-- title of widget; will be placed under icon (can be left empty) -->
    <icon_title>Iframe Template</icon_title>
    <!-- namespace of widget (namespace = javascript object) -->
    <widget_object>iframeTemplateWidget</widget_object>
    <!-- optional setting; Minimum role for this widget. Defaults to NULL (=Member) -->
    <minimum_role>Admin</minimum_role>
    <!-- optional setting; In_development is flag if this widget is under development (defaults to false). Used in syncronization of widgets. -->
    <in_development>true</in_development>
    <!-- allow multiple instances (yes or no) -->
    <allow_multiple>no</allow_multiple>
    <!--
        list of files to be loaded relative to main folder of widgets
        (theese files will be loaded upon project start)
        
        valid types are; javascript, css

        note; if a file/resource is external then use the attribute external="true" with a full path
    -->
	<load>
		<file type="javascript">js/iframe-template.js</file>
		<file type="css">css/iframe-styles.css</file>
		<file type="javascript" external="true">https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/swfobject/2.2/swfobject.js</file>
	</load>
    <!-- sql-file for installation -->
    <install>wiki_install.sql</install>
    <!-- file for uninstallation when removing widget(s)-->
    <uninstall>wiki_uninstall.sql</uninstall>
</settings>
}}}

=== Database syncronization ===
Some settings/tags will be syncronized with the database - you only have to change in the settings.xml file and the database will be updated when the application is refreshed the next time.

Settings/tags that will be syncronized:
 * in_development (if none; default false)
 * minimum_role (if none; default null)
 * install / uninstall (if none or one tag is missing; no database)

=== About install/uninstall ===
Both the tag install and uninstall is required and must have a valid sql-file or it will fail. If you want to place it in a sub-directory then enter the path relative to the widget-folder. You can for example place all sql-files in a sub-directory and then protect that directory with a htaccess-file.

=== About loading files ===
In the tag 'load' it is possible to use these types: 'css' and/or 'javascript'. If the file is external and not in the widget-folder then add the attribute "external" together with a full path.
